sections.summary: Gold is not a commodity; it is a currency. It is the only financial asset that is not someone else's liability. It measures the quality of fiat currencies, and lately, the quality is poor.
sections.deep_dive: Historically, Gold traded inversely to Real Interest Rates (when rates rose, gold fell). This correlation broke in 2022. Gold rose WITH rates. This signals a regime change: central banks are buying Gold not for returns, but for sovereignty and sanction-proofing.

sections.forecast_risks: A liquidity crisis where everything is sold to raise cash (like March 2020). Gold can drop 10-15% in a week during a panic, but it is usually the first to recover.
sections.gms_conclusion: This is no longer a trade; it is a required holding. The 'Anti-Fiat' trade is the defining theme of the decade.
